channel.title: Comments on: Danger in Design: Why bother with Architecture ?
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: damber
item.dc:creator: damber
item.content:encoded:
Thanks Chopstik, glad it’s useful.

It’s all too easy to overlook architecture if it’s not a natural part of the process (which for many organisations it is not). Hopefully this analogy with the construction industry goes a little way toward convincing “non-architects” of the importance of developing and working to an architecture.

item.title: By: chopstik
item.dc:creator: chopstik
item.content:encoded:
Damber,

An excellent post and one that I can use to explain to others why things should be done a certain way before the fact instead of the way that they’re often done now. Thanks!
